website_summaries.verdict: A compact tent that's perfect for backpacking trips or car camping with a small group.
pros: Innovative Lite Reflect system allows you to enjoy a useful glow of light all around just by putting a light in the gear loft and aiming it at a built-in reflective panel
Easy to put up and fit back into its carrying bag
cons: Not much room left for gear if you're sleeping 4 or 5 people in the tent

customer_reviews.title: Used for 6 years!
customer_reviews.text: Great basic tent! Fits two queen mattresses, 4 people can sleep comfortably , not much room for anything else. We've camped in all kinds of weather and climate in the last 6 years with children using the tent and testing everything. This tent continues to hold up great, we have not had to make any repairs whatsoever. The zippers have gotten stuck a few times but easily came loose with no damages. We are getting a bigger tent because our family has grown but this tent has really proven itself. We just went camping in alpine Sierra Nevada mountains last week! Great little tent for a couple or small family.
customer_reviews.author: S. Houser

customer_reviews.title: Not just good. Good enough.
customer_reviews.text: I guess the most important thing is, I'd buy this tent again. It didn't come with the lite-reflect system. But I don't really care about that. The tent is pretty easy to put up (one person can do it, but two is easier). I used it in moderate rain, and it stayed dry inside. I don't like the door (you can only open half of it).
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent, avid camper
customer_reviews.text: Searched and searched for tents read review after review and I am so happy with this purchase. The tent was better than expected and excellent quality! I never water sealed it and as long as you do not touch the tent when it rains it does not leak. I have used it several time before posting this review and it exceeded my expectations. It’s durable and a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!!!
customer_reviews.text: Aweeome tent! This super nice tent was big enough to comfortably fit myself and my sister, her full size air bed, my twin size bed AND our luggage!! Very easy to set up too! First time camping experience was memorable and favorable!!
customer_reviews.author: Bianca Young

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Tent is fine, fit a queen sized air mattress, 2 people gear and are 8lb dog. Being sideways in the tent was a bit strange. The door is a kind of a pain and the zipper got stuck a little to easy. The middle stake straps are not positioned quite right and you cannot get them snug to the ground, next time we will stake them fist and then the corners to see how that works. It held up to 15-20mph wind, there was no rain. Was easy to put up and take down. Buy other tent stakes.
customer_reviews.author: KRW

customer_reviews.title: Two entrances with 4 zippers that snag with each use
customer_reviews.text: First, the zippers catch during every use. We also had rain on our very first night of use for about 10 minutes of light rain. I felt several drops on my face while trying to sleep. The design is terrible. The entrance consists of 2 separate halves and each half has two zippers that meet. They are not continuous!. That made zipper catching all the more frustrating. Four zippers and two doors for the entrance. It's ridiculous, I couldn't even get my full size mattress in/out barely. I've had Wenzel products last me almost 30 years but this one is garbage and is poorly designed. Waiting on my refund now!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Linde

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t leak in the rain, Sleeps 3 with mattresses, zippers malfunction, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used this tent three times and camped in it once. Sleeps 3 with blow up mattresses (maybe it sleeps five in sleeping bags?) the zipper consistently gets stuck on the material and it’s difficult to avoid that happening even by trying to hold the material in front of where you are going to zipper and one of the poles partially cracked and my mom and I needed up with 20-30 tony shards of fiber glass in our hands and arms from just handling it. I’m having difficulty finding customer services but assume I will find it and that they will send me a replacement pole.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Ossa

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT and not too complicated
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT and not too complicated. After our camping trip it fit perfectly back into the carrying case. I would highly recommend. We housed one queen size air mattress and one twin size air mattress without any problems plus we still had a little walking space between the mattresses to move around.
customer_reviews.author: MizzShy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. A good summer tent. A little concerned about a couple of pole sections that seem kinked, but no problems yet. Echoing the complaint about flaps over the door zippers constantly getting caught in the teeth, but easy to clear. The split doorway is a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clark

customer_reviews.title: We have used it 3 times
customer_reviews.text: Only problem was the zipper catching on the sewn piece other wise plenty of room for 2. Cots and another adult but with a full and mid sized dogs it was perfect we still had room to move around. Easy to put up and take down we liked the open top and sides for air flow at night we have only used it 3 times I like to food it up and put it In the truck. When we get home set it back up clean and debris out and off let it air out and make sure it's dry then fold it and put it back in its bag. It fits our need
customer_reviews.author: Dann

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Wenzel tent and we are very impressed with both the quality and it's design. It went up in about 5 minutes. All the seams are excellent, zippers are well made and both the windows and doors have zip up privacy covers when needed. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great for little families
customer_reviews.text: Our first timeout with this tent, it rained lightly all weekend. After having done some additional water proofing with some spray-on Kiwi stuff, I was confident the tent would not leak. However, after three days of the ground getting soggy and mucky and gross, I was worried about the floor. I had only brought a small tarp for the ground, partially covering underneath the tent floor. Nevertheless, we all stayed toasty and dry inside, despite nature's attempts to make us otherwise. Update: 4 years later. Still love this tent. Still good as new. We camp a lot, so this guy is a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia A. Earhart

customer_reviews.title: Wenzel Pine Ridge 5 Person Tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent!! Easy to set up and take down and can pack easily on our motorcycles. This has plenty of room for two people and all of your spare gear and bags. When buying a camping tent, use the 3-up rule: Take the number of persons who will sleep in the tent and add 3. That's the size tent to get. That way, you have plenty of room to fit two persons' stuff in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: The Ghost

customer_reviews.title: It's a good size for 2 adults and 2 kids
customer_reviews.text: It's a good size for 2 adults and 2 kids, if you don't bring a ton of stuff with you. It is easy to pack and light to carry. It handles rain ok but I have other tents that are better in rain. The zipper can be a bit annoying but is not a deal breaker to me. However, now I can't use it anymore. One of the tension bars snapped last weekend in the wind. We were 12 families and some with bigger tents, but ours was the only one that couldn't take the wind. :(
customer_reviews.author: mitoboru

customer_reviews.title: One of the best made tents I've ever owned with good weather proofing ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best made tents I've ever owned with good weather proofing features. This includes the flap over the zippers many complain about. Just pay attention and don't rush when using the zipper and you won't have any problems. Yes, 4-5 people could sleep in this tent but would have little room for gear. However, it is quite roomy and comfortable for two people. It is not truly a two room tent .....it just comes with a flimsy divider you can hang from the top of the tent. All in all I am very pleased with this purchace.
customer_reviews.author: energizer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent! Great value!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this tent at the last minute for our first family camping trip. My husband and I are former backpackers and were avid campers, pre-kids, so I honestly was a little worried that this tent wouldn't live up to the quality I demanded from my earlier camping purchases. We spent just one night in the woods, but the tent was great. It even survived an afternoon storm with no leaking whatsoever. There was plenty of room for our family of four -- but our kids are just 1 and 4. I think with older kids you might want more room. I'm really pleased with this purchase, and am happy I didn't spend more!
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Great for starters
customer_reviews.text: My bf and I just used this tent for the 1st time, this past weekend and it was great! We had a queen air mattress, so the room divider wasnt practical. But, that did make the front doors a little weird. But, its designed to be a shared tent. Only reason that we didnt give it 5 stars, is that rain came in, in the back of the tent. When we took the air mattress out of it, we found pools of water under the mattress. Great starter tent tho!! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L'Italien

customer_reviews.title: Great tent at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: After camping for several years, decided it was time to upgrade to a unit that would hold a cot versus the traditional air mattresses. This one fit the bill. In reality, 4 persons would be a bit tight, it is perfect for two or GREAT for one. Plenty of room left over with a cot, able to stand up almost straight for changing clothes. Very well constructed, took approximately 10 minutes or less to setup and the features were great. A bit windy the first day and the tent held up very well. Breakdown and packing took even less time. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wooten

customer_reviews.title: This is a good, decent tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, decent tent. My only complaint is that the zippers catch and snag really badly, it was enough of a frustration for me to downgrade from 4 to 3. The first time we tried to use the zipper on one side it snagged on the way up about three-quarters of the way and never released, it's still stuck. This tent is not a good choice if you need something that will retain warmth in low temps.
customer_reviews.author: Snufalaragus

customer_reviews.title: So far the tent meets requirements
customer_reviews.text: I just put the tent up today and it looks good. Very easy to set up, took me about 10 minutes. I did waterproof it but will have to see what camping in the rain brings. The zipper flap does catch if you are not careful but that is because it has a flap around it to keep out rain. If you recognize that, the zipper works fine. Just don't quickly unzip the tent. Looks like enough space for a couple twin air mattresses and maybe then even a little room. Good ventilation and has storage pockets which are great for sunglasses and cellphones. Overall seems like a nice tent.
customer_reviews.author: M. Garneau

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonderfully for camping and was able to sleep 4 campers ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked wonderfully for camping and was able to sleep 4 campers inside of it comfortably! Not too horrible to assemble but like all tents, it's not the easiest thing in the world. But I'd highly recommend this, especially for the price. It rained while we were camping and no water came in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a good tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for a recent camping trip as it was well-reviewed and fit my budget. It's a good tent for the money. The zipper issue is not a big deal as long as you are mindful of it. There was some leakage at the seams in the tub floor but nothing too bad considering it rained consistently for one day and typhooned the next. This tent stood up to the elements pretty well but I'd recommend hitting it with some Camp Dry and seam sealer just to be safe. It was pretty easy for two people to put up (in the dark no less). Overall very happy. Would've been 5 stars if not for the leaking.
customer_reviews.author: AnxiousCucumber

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, easy quick and easy set up especially after you do it once. I used a seam sealer as soon as I set it up the first time, as you should always do that with a new tent. high quality and good design. My only complaint is on the front door zippers and the water flap they have over them, it gets caught in the zipper every time, you really have to open it slowly to avoid it getting stuck. The Kept us dry after a short but very heavy rain.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: very happy with this tent- good size- roomy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son and daughter in law for my sons bday...very happy with this tent- good size- roomy. They set it up in their living room they were very happy..looking forward to many camping trips! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: monelli

customer_reviews.title: Wenzel 10x8 4-5 person Tent is GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This tent was easy to put up and take down. Plenty of room for a young family or 4 adults. I do agree with some earlier reviews that the door zipper gets stuck on the flap of material which covers the zipper. You have to be very careful when using the zipper. The zipper got stuck several times which was a concern especially in the middle of the night.. That is why I rated the tent 4-star. I have a smaller Wenzel 2-3 person tent which does not have the extra material and zipper does not get stuck.. otherwise the 4-5 person tent is a great item and was received right on time or a day early.
customer_reviews.author: yellowdawes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent all around!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. It is sturdy and so far has proven to be waterproof and holds up well in strong winds. It is easy for me to set up and take down by myself. The one thing I wish was different would be about 6-10in more height because I'm 5'2 and I can't stand straight in it.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine M. Cammack

customer_reviews.title: The tent is pretty easy to set up by myself
customer_reviews.text: The tent is pretty easy to set up by myself. So far the tent has remained dry, but have only had rain, not any heavy storms. As stated in other reviews that I did not fully understand, the door openings are two separate openings with a the zippers in the middle. You have to inflate the mattress inside the tent. Fortunately I have a battery operated mattress. One bigger door would be much better. Overall it is a good tent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble - durable - may need extra stakes
customer_reviews.text: Durable and trustworthy - rain fly seems to move around a lot with wind, but I'm guessing this would be the case with any tent. VERY EASY to set up - maybe takes 10 minutes total. Nice circulation inside. Please purchase Coleman kit with other stakes and hammer if you want it to stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: The tent was easy to set up and very roomy
customer_reviews.text: The tent was easy to set up and very roomy. We fit a queen and twin size air mattress with about 1ft space between.
customer_reviews.author: marcia frost

customer_reviews.title: It’s good I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product. It’s almost like the picture. But I face some trouble while doing the corners. There is no appropriate place to hold the stick. I just have to shove it in between the black strips.
customer_reviews.author: Hind moh. Al-Ali

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: I got this tent in green. It's a great tent for what I use it for- car camping. It has plenty of room inside, enough for a queen size air mattress with room to spare (without the divider). It may take some effort, but it fits back in it's original bag. My only complaint is it's hard to put up and take down with just one person.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tent
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable tent with easy set up and take down. Lots of room inside for a queen mattress plus more. I ended up getting a second one for the rest of my family.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Denson

customer_reviews.title: Two Tall People Give Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: Honey and I are 6’3” and 6’4” and we fit!! With space and two dogs! Great tent, we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kara and Casey

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup nice with the rain good design but enough ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup nice with the rain good design but enough for only 4 people with sleeping bag if with mattress 3-4 people
customer_reviews.author: layth

customer_reviews.title: Nice Economy Tent
customer_reviews.text: We liked this tent very much except for two things. First, the double D-style doors are much smaller than a single D, making it more difficult to move large items in/out. Second, the bottoms of the doors sit about 8 inches above ground level, which creates a tripping hazard when entering or exiting. There is a loop to stake the bottom of the tent down to minimize this rise, but the stakes provided are short and don't stay in the ground under the usual traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof at all, used one time, leaked very badly and returned item. Return process went well. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Great light tent, light reflect feature absent from my green version...  :/
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, it fits exactly 2 queen mattresses (big intex ones), so pretty luxurious for 4 people, but with little space for backpack... with camping gear it'd do much better with equipment at the feet. The light reflection feature that they advertise on the main page is indeed absent from my green version, I hear red version has this "awesome" feature. It's no biggie, but still is advertisement. It's a little over 10lb, which is pretty damn light for a tent this size, so if you split the weight among 4 campers, it makes for a decent 2.5lb/person. So it actually makes for a decent hiking tent if you like the people you hike with :)
customer_reviews.author: Edom

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: It fit a queen and a double air mattress in there! Perfect for a couple and two kids. No mosquitos from nearby lake got in and bothered is either. I wish it were more opaque.
customer_reviews.author: WONREDSTICK GUY

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the tent and used a few times. In a wind storm, one of the fiberglass poles split. No customer service support to replace. Will never buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Sanabria

customer_reviews.title: Its ok.
customer_reviews.text: It's a descent summer tent. It has quite a bit of 'mesh' so it gets a little breezy if cold and windy. A little expensive for what ya get, but it's not garbage. Used it a couple times and hasn't fallen apart.
customer_reviews.author: MountainWalker

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Went to a camping music festival and it poured one of the days. Tent kept me and everything dry. A little damp because the amount of rain that hit the zipper. Love the tent real roomy totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Almeida

customer_reviews.title: zipper came off track 1st time using
customer_reviews.text: the first night we used this the zipper got snagged on the orange cloth and then separated completely. I got it put back together but it came apart again. We are back home now and are going to set it up in the yard to dry it (since we had a down pour) and I will see what I can do to fix it. Other wise a good buy. but my hubby was not happy with it.Our 2 grandsons(17 and 14) stayed in it and were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: grammacake

customer_reviews.title: Tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent, and we have used it multiple times already, and once it rained and there were no leaks. It is definitely a four person tent. The only way 5 people could fit is if they were all children. This tent is so easy to set up, and it only took us 5 minutes. I would recommend this tent to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Easily put it up by myself, at night using my car's headlight the first time. Beautiful weather that weekend, so I didn't bother using the rain fly. Each side of the divider can handle a queen air mattress. It is cool that each side has its own door. The light reflect system is a nice feature. I briefly used a flashlight just to see how well it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to try this tent out in a camping situation but I did set it up in my front yard just to see how big It is and make sure I would be able to set it up by my self later. I have to say this looks to be a great tent, it has plenty of room and is easy enough for one person to set up and take down with no problems. The room divider makes this tent into two semi private rooms which is just what I expected it to do. I can't wait to take this out camping.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. It held out the rain. Yes, the zipper can stick but you just have to be careful. I found I had no problems with it if I just pulled the door from the corner to open it. I think this tent is worth every penny. B
customer_reviews.author: N. Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: and there is a useless room divider
customer_reviews.text: The double door means the front door is split in two, and there is a useless room divider. I thought there were two doors, one on either side of the tent. Other than that....great tent. Solid construction, and light for its size.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Cranston

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used this in any heavy weather yet (because we don't get much of it in the Southwest!) but this is well made, goes together quickly, and breaks down just as easily. We fit a queen-sized air mattress in it with room to spare on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: ReyAce

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for money
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent, in our second season with it. Easy to put up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the kids and I love this tent one of the best I have found ...
customer_reviews.text: we get some strong winds and strong storms, it has held up and it hasn't leaked except once, the kids and I love this tent one of the best I have found in a long time I recommend It to any one
customer_reviews.author: michelle johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great tent! Used it for 2 adults and 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Used it for 2 adults and 2 dogs and there was still plenty of space. It rained the first time I used it and it held up well. Easy to set up and take down. This tent comes with weak metal stakes that bent the first time I used it. Be sure to get the Coleman tent kit which has a mallet, 4 strong metal stakes, stake puller, and brush/dust pan. The door zippers are a little annoying when opening with one hand because they caught. The Lite-reflect feature seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: spacious tent
customer_reviews.text: Took my husband 10 minutes to set up. Tried it in our living room first to make sure it wasn't damaged before going camping had no problems just be careful with the zipper. If you go to fast it does get stuck you just have to zip slowly. Great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Cinderella

customer_reviews.title: 4-5 kids maybe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent, sturdy zippers, good insulation, good poles, but it is small. it fits a queen size air mattress and a couple duffe ebags. nothing else. do not be fooled by the 4 - 5 person rating. Otherwise it is a great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Both front zippers broke on the first time using it. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B

customer_reviews.title: summer
customer_reviews.text: love this tent, packs up small. easy set up. has more room then we thought. I would get different stakes they just have the little cheap ones. it was also easy pack back up.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for two!
customer_reviews.text: As usual, the 4 person tent means its for 2 people and their stuff, but knowing this when I went to buy it meant no surprises when it comes to space! Great tent and easy to set up! good quality for the price you pay
customer_reviews.author: Johnny2steakS

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! Perfect size plus extra room for just the two of us! The door is weird because it's a double door but other then that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: casandra

customer_reviews.title: Decent Tent
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an in expensive tent to be used a couple times a year. This tent was a decent size and easily setup with just myself and 3 year old. The overall size I would say is 3-4 man though as I find it tough to get a 5th into it. The included divider also seems that it would make it difficult to have more than 2 people in it as it would make them sleep shorwise of the tent instead of long wise. Overall a good tent for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Darkfire

customer_reviews.title: Love Camping
customer_reviews.text: Easy up and easy down. Roomy for two adults and our things. Quality is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Great family tent with its room divider and double door
customer_reviews.text: Great family tent with its room divider and double door. Very roomy. Zippers can get snagged if you rush them.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent. Easy set up and great space
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent. Easy set up and great space. Actually set it up in the house for the little tykes and they did the indoor camping deal. Great price and nice tent, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping! Love the tent!
customer_reviews.text: Just did receive the tent. Love it! Easy to set up, and I was going to spray it with water repellent; it just beaded and rolled off. I don't think we will have any problems with leaks.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Lucky to get 2 persons in this tent. Cord for tent poles broke after one use
customer_reviews.author: kent johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Have only set it up - not actually used yet. Easy to set up. Do not really like how the poles fit into the fly - but it is do-able. My husband did not like the seam construction - but it is a low priced tent - what do you expect.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Held up very well to the rain while we were ...
customer_reviews.text: Held up very well to the rain while we were out camping and I hadn't even had the chance to put the sealant on it yet that I had purchased before our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Karisia3

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews and trying to stay in a reasonable price range, this was the one we decided on. Very easy to put up and take down. This is very user friendly, couldn't be happier!!!
customer_reviews.author: k beasley

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent for the Price !
customer_reviews.text: A great tent for the price ... I would say it fits two adult people comfortably, with place for some gear inside.
customer_reviews.author: Herb H

customer_reviews.title: Love it :)
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tent. Took it out quite a few times. Takes about 5 mins to set up :)
customer_reviews.author: Nojokeimhigh

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. We have two of them now and they have held up very well even in very strong desert winds. The zippers do get stuck a bit but what tent doesn't have this issue. Have not camped in rain so cannot comment on water resistance. I'm 5'6" and can stand up in this tent. It's large enough to sleep three 6 ft tall teens and house all their gear.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly W.

customer_reviews.title: hit the road again?
customer_reviews.text: they have already sleep in ,and want to go camping again.
customer_reviews.author: judy riha

customer_reviews.title: spacious tent for a family of 4
customer_reviews.text: good value. only used once so far in nice conditions. worked great
customer_reviews.author: Hale

customer_reviews.title: lots of space
customer_reviews.text: this our second wenzel pine ridge tent. the first one lasted 8 years, and we bought a new one only because we expanded our family. it is spacious, NEVER leaked except from the bottom a little, but if you have good floor covering or mats you should be fine. also, it is possible to stand up and get dressed in the middle of the tent, and my kids like that. for years we had tents that you need to crawl in and out of.
customer_reviews.author: andjela cupic

customer_reviews.title: This was very nice the top for the light was an awesome addition ...
customer_reviews.text: This was very nice the top for the light was an awesome addition to camping sewn in the seams very well and did not leak
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Good tent but low quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in December and used it for the first time in May. In the first usage itself, the elastic string that goes through the poles just broke! I am yet to contact the seller and see what they could do about it, but I was so disappointed at the camping site and I had no excuses to convince my 8 year old son who was so excited on his first camping!!! The material for the tent looks good quality, but couldn't confirm since I couldn't use it...I am not sure whether I would recommend this to anybody:-(
customer_reviews.author: S.Nair

customer_reviews.title: Camping Out
customer_reviews.text: My sons use this tent. its big enough for the both of them just to where they don't get on each other's nerves and has room for their things to keep them separate.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wiggles2013

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Standard tent. But it doesn't sleep 5 unless you are talking five kids. And even then, I don't think so. It's more like a 3 to 4 person tent.
customer_reviews.author: GWS

customer_reviews.title: A great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tent. Easy to assemble and break down. We loved camping with this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Poteaux

customer_reviews.title: Love my tent!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new tent - easy to put up and break down, waterproof. Zipper will stick like I read in the reviews if I'm not careful but no biggie if I don't yank on it. Two rooms? No, that's a joke but it's comfortable with my cot and stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Naomi Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this tent. Really well constructed and stays dry. Very easy to set up and is roomy enough for 3 with stuff inside
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME tent.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent. This was exactly as advertised and we have enjoyed owning this tent tremendously. We camped at Ft Wilderness in Orlando until it just got to hot to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R. Mcconnell

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely roomy! Took it camping on Mt Ranier fit a queen and a twin mattress with space to spare. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, the zippers...
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews before buying this tent, really the only complaint seemed to be about the zippers always getting stuck. I figured that was a minor complaint, I would just be careful, and bought the tent. Yeah, even being careful, the zippers constantly get stuck. Good tent, but that is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: toys

customer_reviews.title: I can't fault it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have ordered this tent. (I gave the first one away because I didn't have space to take it home on the plane). I can't fault it. It's easy to put up and exactly as advertised. It's a good size and the two rooms are really handy because I kept the bedding half of my tent clean.
customer_reviews.author: Miss I. M. Davison-lungley

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It's a very spacious tent. I love my family of four and our luggage can all fit in there. We did feel cold though. Probably not the right tent for colder weather.
customer_reviews.author: Alencar

customer_reviews.title: good tent
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my grandson for Christmas-he really enjoys all the room for his cot and of course the dog.
customer_reviews.author: K. Corbett

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this Wenzel tent!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's SUPER easy to setup. Took us about 15mins or less to prop it up each time. We took it out for a 4 day camping trip in Sequoia and it performed nicely through some of the windy nights. Very spacious for a couple. You can fit a queen size mattress with plenty of room left over for all your camping gear.
customer_reviews.author: Layla

customer_reviews.title: Very good Tent!
customer_reviews.text: this Tent was my summer home i am very pleased with how well it is put together but was only able to fit a queen size air mattress in it and not much room to move around but for the price it has been a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: tracyfamily

customer_reviews.title: We love this tent
customer_reviews.text: This reminds me of how camping tents were built over a decade ago. Very durable with no prolems after all the use we gave it from this year.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Improve the zipper to achieve 5 star.  Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Overall excellent product. Easy to set up and take down. Pretty waterproof. My only drawback is the zipper system. It's good quality but somewhat tricky to operate.
customer_reviews.author: JCraig

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I've used this twice so far, once a year, & absolutely love it. Very easy instructions & durable material. I've never assembled a tent before & was able to do so with this one in about 20 minutes by myself. No help necessary unless you're in a hurry :)
customer_reviews.author: Cristal Taveras

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought seven of these tents for our easter campore. All the users were satisfied, they got value for their money. It remained dry after a heavy downpour of rain. If you intend to keep your bags and use a cot, don't have more than 3 persons in the tent. If it is only for sleeping, it would work as a four man tent.
customer_reviews.author: Rajar

customer_reviews.title: Value and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I have camped for years and used many tents. This is the second one of these I have purchased as it is well designed and meets needs for 3 people. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Dianna in Fairdealing

customer_reviews.title: Wenzel Pine Ridge 10-by-8 Foot... WELL WORTH THE MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: WAS VERY EASY TO SET UP AND TAKE DOWN. WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TENT TO ANYONE IT'S GOOD FOR A WEEKEND GET AWAY.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Frie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry and use as well
customer_reviews.text: It has ample amount of space for a family of 3. Easy to carry and use as well. Con: Just in the second usage the pole string broke. I wish Wenzel should give few spare pole strings.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: What a fun playhouse for my granddaughters
customer_reviews.text: What a fun playhouse for my granddaughters. We will leave it up all summer and, if it survives, we will donate it to a homeless person when we take it down. It was easy to put up and is very spacious.
customer_reviews.author: S Smith

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Used for one cub scout camp out so far. Roomy and good for a young family. It would be hard to sleep 5 adults. Easy to set up, just a little help from my 6 year old Cub Scout to hold up the center.
customer_reviews.author: lost canadian

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: A typical 5 man tent that only 2 full size adults and their gear can fit into. Real drag that the door is split in two. I don't have a clue why someone thought that was a good idea. Look at the picture, the front door only opens half way on the vertical. Not easy to get in and out of or if you have a sizable mattress you will need to take it in and out deflated. I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: scott mackey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent, pretty good size for our family(We have 4 people)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: zipper broken
customer_reviews.text: Got the tent for my kids at Christmas and was now just using it and the zipper broke within 5 minutes. Product past the return window. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Jim Frehley

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I thought the Tent worked Exactly like a tent should. We didn't have any problems with the Zipper as other's have claimed. It was big and Roomie. My husband,daughter, neice, nephew, and myself all slept in it and still had plenty of room. I would recommend this tent. It works great and its inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Cutter

product_meta.title: Wenzel Pine Ridge Tent - 5 Person
product_meta.description:
This lightweight (11. 51 lbs.) tent is designed for the sport of backpacking. Experience camping nirvana with the bestselling, highly versatile Pine Ridge 5-person tent that turns shelter into an outdoor suite.

AMAZON.COM
Spacious and weather-resistant, the Wenzel Pine Ridge 10-by-8-foot dome tent sleeps four to five campers in its two rooms, making it ideal for small families or couples with lots of gear. The Pine Ridge is made of rugged, weather-repellent Weather Armor polyester with a polyurethane coating for reliability, helping it keep water out and warmth in. The sonic-sealed, polyethylene tub-style floor, meanwhile, is welded and not sewn, eliminating needle holes that might otherwise attract water seepage. And campers will love the variety of ventilation points--including two mesh doors, one mesh window, and a mesh roof--which combine to create a refreshing cross breeze on warm evenings. 

 The Pine Ridge is also easy to set up, with shock-corded fiberglass poles and grommet pole attachments. And when it comes time to hit the sheets, you can either create one large sleeping room or roll down the divider curtain to create two separate rooms. The rooms can function as individual bedrooms for the campers or as a sleeping room and living area. Other details include a hooped fly at the front and rear for weather protection, two hanging pockets for storage, and a storage duffel. 

 Specifications:

 * Base: 10 by 8 feet 
 * Center height: 60 inches 
 * Area: 80 square feet 
 * Capacity: 4 to 5 people 
 * Carrying weight: 11.9 pounds 
 * Warranty: 10 years 

 Amazon.com Tent Guide 
Selecting a Tent
Fortunately, there are all kinds of tents for weekend car campers, Everest expeditions, and everything in-between. Here are a few things to keep in mind: 

 Expect the Worst
In general, it's wise to choose a tent that's designed to withstand the worst possible conditions you think you'll face. For instance, if you're a summer car camper in a region where weather is predictable, an inexpensive family or all-purpose tent will likely do the trick--especially if a vehicle is nearby and you can make a mad dash for safety when bad weather swoops in. If you're a backpacker, alpine climber, or bike explorer, or if you like to car camp in all seasons, you'll want to buy something designed to handle more adversity. 

 Three- and Four-Season Tents
For summer, early fall, and late spring outings, choose a three-season tent. At minimum, a quality three-season tent will have lightweight aluminum poles, a reinforced floor, durable stitching, and a quality rain fly. Some three-season tents offer more open-air netting and are specifically designed for summer backpacking or other activities. Many premium tents will also feature pre-sealed, taped seams and a silicone-impregnated rain fly for enhanced waterproofing. 

 For winter camping or alpine travel, go with a four-season model. Because they typically feature more durable fabric coatings, as well as more poles, four-season tents are designed to handle heavy snowfall and high winds without collapsing. Of course, four-season tents exact a weight penalty of about 10 to 20 percent in trade for their strength and durability. They also tend to be more expensive. 

 Domes and Tunnels
Tents are broadly categorized into two types: freestanding, which can stand up on their own, and tents that must be staked down in order to stand upright. Freestanding tents often incorporate a dome-shaped design, and most four-season tents are constructed this way because a dome leaves no flat spots on the outer surface where snow can collect. Domes are also inherently stronger than any other design. Meanwhile, many three-season models employ a modified dome configuration called a tunnel. These are still freestanding, but they require fewer poles than a dome, use less fabric, and typically have a rectangular floor plan that offers less storage space than a dome configuration. Many one and two-person tents are not freestanding, but they make up for it by being lighter. Because they use fewer poles, they can also be quicker to set up than a dome. 

 Size Matters
Ask yourself how many people you'd like to fit in your fabric hotel now and in the future. For soloists and minimalists, check out one-person tents. If you're a mega-minimalist, or if you have your eye on doing some big wall climbs, a waterproof-breathable bivy sack is the ticket. Some bivy sacks feature poles and stake points to give you a little more breathing room. Also, if you don't need bug protection and you want to save weight, check out open-air shelters. 

 Families who plan on car camping in good weather can choose from a wide range of jumbo-sized tents that will accommodate all your little ones with room to spare. A wide range of capacities is available for three- and four-season backpacking and expedition tents. Remember, though, the bigger the tent you buy, the heavier it will be, although it's easy to break up the tent components among several people in your group. It's also helpful to compare the volume and floor-space measurements of models you're considering.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA or Imported
4- to 5-person, 2-room family dome tent ideal for smaller families
Weather Armor polyester construction with polyurethane coating
2 mesh doors, 1 mesh window, and mesh roof for cross breeze
Shock-corded fiberglass poles and grommet attachment system for easy setup
Hanging divider curtain; measures 10 x 5 x 8 feet (W x H x D)
